clinical_study.brief_title: Using Smart Phone Technology in Detecting the Presence of Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Accuracy of an Atrial Fibrillation Detection Algorithm Using Novel Smart Phone Technology in Detecting the Presence of Atrial Fibrillation. iRead Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine whether patients can use the AliveCor case to record their heart rhythm and to assess the accuracy of the software in detecting AF vs sinus rhythm

detailed_description.textblock: AliveCor is a new monitoring technology used with a smart phone which allows patients to record their rhythm. The study will compare AliveCor recordings and automated interpretation of the rhythm with the interpretation by an Electrophysiologist.

primary_outcome.measure: Examine the accuracy of the AliveCor software in detecting AF or sinus rhythm compared to the physician interpretation
primary_outcome.description: Both the software nd overreading electrophysiologist come to the same conclusion regarding the rhythm of the ECG and Alivecor reading. Both determining that the tracing is either normal sinus rhythm or atrial fibrillation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the correlation between QT interval derived from the AliveCor device compared to standard 12 lead ECG, as assessed by the overreading electrophysiologists.

arm_group.description: Patients with Atrial Fibrillation admitted to the hospital for drug loading with Dofetilide or Sotalol willing to record and transmit heart rhythm using AliveCor.

intervention.description: The patient uses the AliveCor device to record and transmit heart rhythm two times a day. The patient, device software, and Electrophysiologist interpret the rhythm

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the hospital for your atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female between > 18 and < 80 years of age
2. Paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation
3. Admitted for antiarrhythmic drug loading (Dofetilide or Sotalol)
4. Already has iPhone 4, 4S or 5 with data plan that accommodates the AliveCor case
5. Willing to use the Alive Cor case
6. Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unable or unwilling to use the Alive Cor case for their smart phone
2. Presence of a permanent pacemaker
